result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin M. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devin M. Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devin M. Anderson was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Court ordered to be served straight time.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests. Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first six months. No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Enroll in a GED or HSED program. Seek and maintain full time employment, full time school, or a combination of both.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive. Cash bail to apply. Defendant to make regular monthly payments. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE. To be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 30 days for the first violation, 60 days for the second violation.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devin M. Anderson in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 90 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 30 days for the first violation, 60 days for the second violation.
- AODA assessment and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first six months.
- Enroll in a GED or HSED program.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, full time school, or a combination of both.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 40 hours of community service, at any nonprofit organization.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.  aw

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance (THC), second or subsequent offense, contrary to WI Stats sec 961.41(1m)(h)2, 939.50(3)(h), 961.48(1)(b).  A class H felony.  

Count 2:  Keeping a drug house, contrary to WI Stats sec 961.42(1), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  aw

Defendant Devin M. Anderson in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Attorney Reddin was tied up in another court.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/20/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin M. Anderson in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Court started taking defendant's plea but was not able to find a factual basis as to count 2.  State to do an amended information.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/11/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin M. Anderson in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons.  aw

Defendant Devin M. Anderson in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:William Kingston-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or in the manner or fashion as prescribed, or no dangerous weapons or firearms.   DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON FEBRUARY 14, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devin M. Anderson in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
